intro: Astraea lobata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf astraea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its slender, strap-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. It is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
